       AN ACT to authorize the Church of God of Brentwood to file  an  applica-
         tion for a real property tax exemption

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. (a) Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the  asses-
    2  sor  of the town of Islip is hereby authorized to accept from the Church
    3  of God of Brentwood an application for an exemption from  real  property
    4  taxes  pursuant  to  section  420-a of the real property tax law for the
    5  2002-2003 assessment roll, as to which March 1,  2002  was  the  taxable
    6  status  date,  with respect to the real property taxes for the 2002-2003
    7  assessment roll for the parcels owned by such church located in the town
    8  of Islip at 77 Marshall Avenue, Brentwood, otherwise known as:  district
    9  500, section 114, block 3, lot 16.
   10    (b)  If accepted, such application shall be reviewed as if it had been
   11  received on or before the taxable status date established for such roll.
   12    If satisfied that such church would  otherwise  be  entitled  to  such
   13  exemption  if  the  church had filed an application for exemption by the
   14  appropriate taxable status date, the assessor of the town of Islip, upon
   15  approval by the town board of such town, may grant  exemption  from  all
   16  taxation based on the 2002-2003 assessment roll and owing by such church
   17  on the effective date of this act and cancel taxes, fines, penalties and
   18  interest  remaining  unpaid,  and  make  appropriate  corrections to the
   19  subject roll.  If such exemption is granted and such church  shall  have
   20  paid any tax with respect to the subject roll, the applicable department
   21  of  the town of Islip, upon the approval of the town board of such town,
   22  may in its sole discretion provide for the refund of  those  taxes  paid
   23  and cancel taxes, fines, penalties or interest remaining unpaid.
   24    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2666

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to authorize the Church of God of Brentwood
to file an application
for a real
property tax exemption

PURPOSE:
To authorize the Town of Islip to grant a real property tax exemption
to the Church of God of Brentwood for payment of real property taxes
in connection with 2002-2003 assessment roll.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
This bill would authorize the assessor of the town of Islip to accept
an application for exemption from real property taxes pursuant to
Section 420-a of the Real Property Tax Law for the 2002-2003
assessment roll. If satisfied that the Church of God of Brentwood
would otherwise have been entitled to said exemption, the assessor is
authorized to grant same, and cancel all remaining unpaid taxes,
interest, related fines and penalties. It would also allow the
assessor of the town of Islip, with the approval of the town board,
to provide for the refund of any taxes that may have been paid by the
Church of God of Brentwood.

JUSTIFICATION:
The Church of God of Brentwood, through administrative oversight,
failed to apply for a real property tax exemption pursuant to section
420-a of the Real Property Tax Law for the 2002-2003 assessment roll
for the parcel it owned in the town of Islip. Due to this
administrative failure, taxes and penalties of $6,920.63 are now due
from the Church and the parcel is threatened by tax lien foreclosure.
This bill would allow the town of Islip to accept a retroactive
application from the Church of God and waive the aforementioned taxes
and penalties now due.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
S.1369: 2009 - Referred to Local Government
        2010 - Passed Senate

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None to the state. The Town of Islip would waive $6,920.63 in taxes
and penalty.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect immediately.
